label: Function 68673064
summary: This function performs linear interpolation between the `start` and `end` geographic coordinates bas...
description: Function description: This function performs linear interpolation between the `start` and `end` geographic coordinates based on proportional time intervals. Given the vessel's stable speed, consistent course over ground (COG), and minimal heading variation—indicating a near-linear trajectory along a fixed route—it is reasonable to model the missing segment as a straight-line path. The function distributes intermediate latitude and longitude points uniformly according to the relative time progression in `Time_interval`, assuming constant velocity motion. This approach aligns with observed vessel behavior: steady navigation with no significant turns or speed changes.

Code implementation: def spatial_function(start, end, Time_interval): return [(start[0] + (end[0] - start[0]) * (t / Time_interval[-1]), start[1] + (end[1] - start[1]) * (t / Time_interval[-1])) for t in Time_interval]

metadata.code: def spatial_function(start, end, Time_interval): return [(start[0] + (end[0] - start[0]) * (t / Time_interval[-1]), start[1] + (end[1] - start[1]) * (t / Time_interval[-1])) for t in Time_interval]
